snippet: Once a vocal critic of Russia’s justice system, the Exxon Mobil chief came to partner with the country’s biggest players. What will that history mean for the slated secretary of state?...
abstract: Exxon Mobil chief Rex W Tillerson, onetime critic of Russian Pres Vladimir Putin and country's investment climate, has radically changed his position since 2008; Tillerson's realization that business success in Russia relies on close relationships with Putin and Rosneft head Igor Sechin has led to $500 billion joint venture in 2011; relationships are expected to undergo scrutiny ahead of Tillerson's confirmation for secretary of state.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and ANDREW E. KRAMER

lead_paragraph: Once a vocal critic of Russia’s justice system, the Exxon Mobil chief came to partner with the country’s biggest players. What will that history mean for the slated secretary of state?

headline.main: How Rex Tillerson Changed His Tune on Russia and Came to Court Its Rulers
headline.print_headline: Exxon Chief’s Lucrative About-Face on Russia
